page.title: 10 Banavie Quarry: 1
page.content: {Stone Produce} Our visit to Banavie Quarry began with a talk given by the Quarry Manager, Mr MacLaren, on the dangers to be met in and around the quarry. Mr MacLaren told us that the quarry, which employs 18 men, sells stone chips and also tar. First we went and saw the quarry cliff where the rockface is drilled and plastic explosive pushed into the holes and fired to bring down the rocks. The bigger rocks are then broken down further by a large crane with a swinging metal ball and all the stones are lifted by diggers onto conveyor belts. The stones pass through sorting machines and move to tall crushing machines where the sorted stones are broken down even further and this process continues until the chips are the size desired.
